availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lucien A. Jones (Christian County, Kentucky, merchant's clerk and merchant.)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, merchant's clerk and merchant. Kentucky native. Son of Davenport Jones and Nancy Jones. Resident of Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Christian County in 1850. Merchant's clerk in Christian County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860. Merchant in Christian County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 442A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 669.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 272A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Christian County, KY, July 1863, p. 26.
"Lucian Jones (1836-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial #89018588, accessed July 14, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89018588/lucian-jones.
